intro: Manettia villosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf or hairy manettia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves, which are often covered in fine, soft pubescence. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are clustered in terminal panicles. Manettia villosa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
